function_call.name: classify_mitigation
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_mitigations":[{"name":"Ensure accurate measurement techniques and criteria for data analysis","category":"Environmental parameters control","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Calibrate measurement instruments and validate data against multiple methods","category":"Environmental parameters control","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use validated computational models and empirical data for analysis","category":"Environmental parameters control","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Implementing real-time air quality monitoring and periodic system recalibration to ensure accurate measurement of air exchange rates","category":"Monitor and control indoor air quality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Automate data collection through official apis or data sources","category":"Monitor and control indoor air quality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Improved data collection, statistical analysis of causal effects, modeling of potential pathways","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use statistical techniques to handle unbalanced panels such as fixed effects models or cluster-robust standard errors","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Consider alternative models that account for non-exponential growth, such as logistic growth models","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Conduct sensitivity analyses to assess the robustness of results to violations of the conditional independence assumption","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incorporate additional data sources and conduct sensitivity analysis","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Consider alternative methods to account for weekly patterns specific to china","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conduct sensitivity analysis and consider alternative methods to capture testing effects","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conduct separate analyses for individual policies to understand their specific impact","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase the sample size of data or use statistical techniques to account for data limitations","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Collect more spatially granular infection data to align with policy variables","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conduct future studies with more data to identify important nonlinearities or interactions between policies","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use robust standard errors robust to error clustering at the day level","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Implement standardized testing and reporting procedures across different regions within a country to minimize the impact of idiosyncratic events on infection growth.","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Develop and implement robust reporting mechanisms, increase testing capacity, and use statistical methods to adjust for underreporting.","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Implement rigorous monitoring and verification processes to ensure accurate reporting of contagious capacity","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conducting robustness checks and exploring alternative models","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Using a distributed-lag model to estimate policy effects without imposing assumptions","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Encouraging future studies to collect more comprehensive data and explore alternative methods of analysis","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incorporate latent period in disease models, improve accuracy of outbreak projections","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Validate empirical approach with seir dynamics, consider the implications of seir models in outbreak analysis","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Validate statistical model accuracy with real-world data, adjust for discrepancies between simulated and real-world conditions","category":"Infection tracking / monitoring","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use multiple sources of data to estimate initial infections and consider a range of case detection rates for more accurate
